# Visual Studio Code Installation Guide for Windows

## Introduction

This guide will walk you through the process of installing Visual Studio Code (VS Code), a popular and versatile code editor, on your Windows computer. VS Code provides a powerful environment for coding and development across various programming languages.

## Prerequisites

Before you begin, ensure you have the following:

1. A Windows computer.
2. An internet connection.

## Installation Steps

### 1. Download Visual Studio Code

Visit the official VS Code download page at [https://code.visualstudio.com/download](https://code.visualstudio.com/download).

### 2. Choose the Windows Installer

Click on the "Windows" download link to download the Visual Studio Code installer for Windows.

![Download VS Code](path/to/screenshot-1.png)

### 3. Run the Installer

- Locate the downloaded installer file (usually in your "Downloads" folder).
- Double-click the installer executable (`.exe`) file to run it.

![Run Installer](path/to/screenshot-2.png)

### 4. Start the Installation

- You will see the VS Code Setup Wizard. Click the "Next" button to begin the installation.

![Setup Wizard](path/to/screenshot-3.png)

### 5. Choose Installation Options

- Select the installation location (the default is usually fine) and click "Next."

![Installation Location](path/to/screenshot-4.png)

- Choose additional tasks if desired (e.g., adding VS Code to the PATH). Then, click "Next."

![Additional Tasks](path/to/screenshot-5.png)

### 6. Install VS Code

Click the "Install" button to begin the installation process. This may take a few moments.

![Install](path/to/screenshot-6.png)

### 7. Launch Visual Studio Code

After the installation is complete, you can leave the "Launch Visual Studio Code" option checked and click "Finish."

![Launch VS Code](path/to/screenshot-7.png)

### 8. Customize VS Code (Optional)

Upon launching, you can customize Visual Studio Code by installing extensions, themes, and configuring settings to suit your development needs.

![Customize VS Code](path/to/screenshot-8.png)

## Conclusion

Congratulations! You've successfully installed Visual Studio Code on your Windows computer. VS Code is now ready for you to use as a powerful code editor for various programming languages.

Feel free to explore the extensions marketplace and customize VS Code to enhance your coding experience. Happy coding!

For more information and documentation on Visual Studio Code, visit [https://code.visualstudio.com/docs](https://code.visualstudio.com/docs).
